poem:
### An Uncommon Orbit  

In the quiet woods,  
a woman once walked,  
where shadows of primates  
taught her their talk.  
While the world spins wild,  
she dares to speak,  
of men on high  
whose bellies reek  
of power consumed.  
Let them float far—  
not stars they seek,  
but an empty bar.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jane Goodall’s grasp of chimpanzees and ‘alpha males’ | Brief letters Many will lament the loss of Jane Goodall not because she had studied chimpanzees and become an authority on male aggression but for her frank and perceptive view of the likes of Donald Trump and Elon Musk and for her encouragement of those fighting against political aggression (Jane Goodall said she would launch Trump and Musk on one-way trip into space, 6 October). Ways". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Jane Goodall’s grasp of chimpanzees and ‘alpha males’ | Brief letters Many will lament the loss of Jane Goodall not because she had studied chimpanzees and become an authority on male aggression but for her frank and perceptive view of the likes of Donald Trump and Elon Musk and for her encouragement of those fighting against political aggression (Jane Goodall said she would launch Trump and Musk on one-way trip into space, 6 October).
